name: RTAB-Map
body: [![video](http://img.youtube.com/vi/AMLwjo80WzI/0.jpg)](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AMLwjo80WzI) # Overview **RTAB-Map** (Real-Time Appearance-Based Mapping) is a RGB-D Graph SLAM approach based on a global Bayesian loop closure detector. The loop closure detector uses a bag-of-words approach to determinate how likely a new image comes from a previous location or a new location. When a loop closure hypothesis is accepted, a new constraint is added to the map's graph, then a graph optimizer minimizes the errors in the map. A memory management approach is used to limit the number of locations used for loop closure detection and graph optimization, so that real-time constraints on large-scale environnements are always respected. RTAB-Map can be used alone with a hand-held Kinect or stereo camera for 6DoF RGB-D mapping, or on a robot equipped with a laser rangefinder for 3DoF mapping. * **RGB-D mapping** * M. Labbé and F. Michaud, “[Online Global Loop Closure Detection for Large-Scale Multi-Session Graph-Based SLAM](https://introlab.3it.usherbrooke.ca/mediawiki-introlab/images/e/eb/Labbe14-IROS.pdf),” in _Proceedings of the IEEE/RSJ International Conference on Intelligent Robots and Systems_, 2014. * Results shown in this paper can be reproduced by the [MultiSessionDemo Multi-session mapping] tutorial. * **Loop closure detection**: * M. Labbé and F. Michaud, “[Appearance-Based Loop Closure Detection for Online Large-Scale and Long-Term Operation](https://introlab.3it.usherbrooke.ca/mediawiki-introlab/images/b/bc/TRO2013.pdf),” in _IEEE Transactions on Robotics_, vol. 29, no. 3, pp. 734-745, 2013. ([IEEE Xplore](http://ieeexplore.ieee.org/xpl/articleDetails.jsp?arnumber=6459608)) * M. Labbé and F. Michaud, “[Memory management for real-time appearance-based loop closure detection](https://introlab.3it.usherbrooke.ca/mediawiki-introlab/images/f/f0/Labbe11memory.pdf),” in _Proceedings of the IEEE/RSJ International Conference on Intelligent Robots and Systems_, 2011, pp. 1271–1276. ([IEEE Xplore](http://ieeexplore.ieee.org/xpls/abs_all.jsp?arnumber=6094602)) Under the hood : * Loop closure hypotheses are evaluated using a Bayes filter. * Image matching is done using a "bag-of-words" approach (with SURF features - OpenCV). * Graph optimization is done with [TORO](https://www.openslam.org/toro.html). * Memory is divided into short-term, working and long-term memories. * Sqlite3 database is used for the long-term memory. # Install | |  |  |  | * [Installation](https://code.google.com/p/rtabmap/wiki/Installation) instructions. * [Tutorials](https://code.google.com/p/rtabmap/wiki/Tutorials). * [Tools](https://code.google.com/p/rtabmap/wiki/Tools). * For **ROS** users, take a look to [ROS page](https://code.google.com/p/rtabmap/wiki/ROS) for a package overview. See also [SetupOnYourRobot](https://code.google.com/p/rtabmap/wiki/SetupOnYourRobot) to know how to integrate RTAB-Map on your robot. ## Troubleshooting Visit the [Tutorials](https://code.google.com/p/rtabmap/wiki/Tutorials), post an [issue](https://code.google.com/p/rtabmap/issues/list) or ask a question on the [ RTAB-Map Forum](http://official-rtab-map-forum.67519.x6.nabble.com/). ## License * Note that RTAB-Map is free for research only because it depends on *SURF* and *SIFT* features. **SIFT** and **SURF** are **not free** for commercial use. * SURF noncommercial notice: http://www.vision.ee.ethz.ch/~surf/download.html * SIFT patent: http://www.cs.ubc.ca/~lowe/keypoints/ # Author * [Mathieu Labbé](https://introlab.3it.usherbrooke.ca/mediawiki-introlab/index.php?title=Mathieu_Labbé&setlang=en) * [RTAB-Map's page at IntRoLab](http://introlab.3it.usherbrooke.ca/mediawiki-introlab/index.php/RTAB-Map) * [Papers](https://introlab.3it.usherbrooke.ca/mediawiki-introlab/index.php/RTAB-Map#Publications) * Similar projects: [Find-Object](http://find-object.googlecode.com) # What's new October 2014 * I added a [RTAB-Map Forum](http://official-rtab-map-forum.67519.x6.nabble.com/) to ask questions, so it will easier to share answers with the community. * New version 0.7.0: * Calibration tool in the Source panel in Preferences. * Binary features can be used for loop closure detection. * [DatabaseViewer](https://code.google.com/p/rtabmap/wiki/Tools#Database_viewer) can remove/add manually loop closures. * Added exportation dialog (`*`.ply `*`.pcd). * ROS: [rviz plugins](https://code.google.com/p/rtabmap/wiki/ROS#RVIZ_plugins): MapCloudDisplay, InfoDisplay, MapGraphDisplay. * Downloads: * Source: [RTABMap-0.7.0-Source.zip](http://bit.ly/1powfmG) * Windows binary: [RTABMap-0.7.0-win64.zip](http://bit.ly/1mM3pRs) * Windows installer: [RTABMap-0.7.0-win64.exe](http://bit.ly/1qSgELI) * New example to speed up RTAB-Map, see the page [FastRGBDMapping](https://code.google.com/p/rtabmap/wiki/FastRGBDMapping): [![video](http://img.youtube.com/vi/Bh8WZsU4YC8/0.jpg)](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Bh8WZsU4YC8) September 2014 * At **IROS 2014** in Chicago, a team using RTAB-Map for SLAM **won** the Kinect navigation contest held during the conference. See their press release for more details: [Winning the IROS2014 Microsoft Kinect Challenge](http://www.meetup.com/SV-ROS-users/pages/Winning_the_IROS2014_Microsoft_Connect_Challenge/). I also added the Wiki page [IROS2014KinectChallenge](https://code.google.com/p/rtabmap/wiki/IROS2014KinectChallenge) showing in details the RTAB-Map part used in their solution. [![video](http://img.youtube.com/vi/_qiLAWp7AqQ/0.jpg)](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_qiLAWp7AqQ) August 2014 * I did a fork of the source code for GitHub and I will keep it synchronised with the svn here. It will be easier for you to customize the code with a fork on GitHub. * [GitHub for RTAB-Map](https://github.com/introlab/rtabmap) * [GitHub for RTAB-Map's ROS package](https://github.com/introlab/rtabmap-ros-pkg) * Here a comparison between reality and what can be shown in RVIZ (you can [reproduce this demo here](https://code.google.com/p/rtabmap/wiki/ROS?ts=1408024477&updated=ROS#Robot_mapping_with_Find-Object)): [![video](http://img.youtube.com/vi/o1GSQanY-Do/0.jpg)](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o1GSQanY-Do) July 2014 * Added [Setup on your robot](https://code.google.com/p/rtabmap/wiki/SetupOnYourRobot) wiki page to know how to integrate RTAB-Map on your ROS robot. Multiple sensor configurations are shown but the optimal configuration is to have a 2D laser, a Kinect-like sensor and odometry. ![AZIMUT3](http://rtabmap.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/doc/Tutorials/MultiSession/4.png) | Onboard mapping | Remote mapping | | --------------- | ------------- | | | | June 2014 * I'm glad to announce that my paper submitted to [IROS 2014](http://www.iros2014.org/) was accepted! [This paper](https://introlab.3it.usherbrooke.ca/mediawiki-introlab/images/e/eb/Labbe14-IROS.pdf) explains in details how RGB-D mapping with RTAB-Map is done. Results shown in this paper can be reproduced by the [Multi-session mapping](https://code.google.com/p/rtabmap/wiki/MultiSessionDemo) tutorial: * Release 0.6.4 * **Binaries!** See [Installation] page for more information. * Release 0.6.3 * (r1330) New icon! * (r1310) Freenect support. * (r1335) Added cloud smoothing (Moving Least Squares) option when saving clouds. * (r1334) Added a quality odometry threshold, turning the background yellow when the mapping area has too low features. * (r1328) Fixed some building issues with OpenCV version: nonFree module explicitly required. This simplified installation for ROS Indigo (r1329). * (r1342) rtabmap-databaseViewer: Added total path length under the Graph view. * Some bug fixes. [Older news](http://code.google.com/p/rtabmap/#Older_news) # Videos *RGBD-SLAM*: [![video](http://img.youtube.com/vi/Nm2ggyAW4rw/0.jpg)](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Nm2ggyAW4rw) [![video](http://img.youtube.com/vi/joV7VCvGrKM/0.jpg)](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=joV7VCvGrKM) *Appearance-based loop closure detection*: [![video](http://img.youtube.com/vi/CAk-QGMlQmI/0.jpg)](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CAk-QGMlQmI) [![video](http://img.youtube.com/vi/1dImRinTJSE/0.jpg)](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1dImRinTJSE) **More videos [here](http://introlab.3it.usherbrooke.ca/mediawiki-introlab/index.php/RTAB-Map)**. # Older news February 2014 * Release 0.6.2 * New [Tools](https://code.google.com/p/rtabmap/wiki/Tools) page. * Updated [Tutorials](https://code.google.com/p/rtabmap/wiki/Tutorials) page (RGB-D mapping, multi-session mapping demos...). * Updated [ROS](https://code.google.com/p/rtabmap/wiki/ROS) usage and demos. December 2013 * Updated trunk to version 0.6. * Ubuntu/ROS updated! * *ROS version*: Because RTAB-Map 0.6 requires PCL 1.7, ROS Hydro is required. The installation is now using Catkin. See the [ROS](https://code.google.com/p/rtabmap/wiki/ROS) page for new RTAB-Map packages installation and usage. The "visual_slam" package doesn't exist anymore, all RGB-D features are handled directly in "rtabmap" package. The mapping demo (ROS bag) from "visual_slam" is updated to new package (see bottom of [ROS](https://code.google.com/p/rtabmap/wiki/ROS#Demos) for launch files). * Example of mapping with a hand-held Kinect (or OpenNI-compliant sensors): [rgbd_mapping.launch](https://rtabmap.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/ros-pkg/launch/rgbd_mapping.launch) ``` $ roslaunch openni_launch openni.launch depth_registration:=true $ roslaunch rtabmap rgbd_mapping.launch ``` * Ubuntu **standalone version**: ``` $ svn checkout http://rtabmap.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/rtabmap rtabmap $ cd rtabmap/build $ cmake .. $ make -j4 $ make install $ rtabmap ``` November 2013 * *(EDIT)* I re-uploaded the zip file with installers for OpenNI. * Added a standalone demo version for RGB-D mapping on Windows 7. * [RTAB-Map-0.6.0-win32-DEMO.zip](https://rtabmap.googlecode.com/files/RTAB-Map-0.6.0-win32-DEMO.zip). * Install: * Unzip * Install OpenNI-Win32-1.5.4-Dev.msi * Install Sensor-Win-OpenSource32-5.1.0.msi * Plug the Kinect * Run bin/RTAB-Map.exe * What's included in the demo: * Hand-held Kinect RGBD mapping, * Modes "Mapping" and "Localization" (that can be switched on-the-fly), * Multiple maps management, * Added a 3D map viewer directly in the RTAB-Map GUI, * Three odometry approaches: * SURF/SIFT (best quality), * FAST/BRIEF (fast), * ICP (slow but invariant to light), * Save the resulting cloud to .pcd file. * (*Ubuntu/ROS users*) In the next weeks, the ROS package will be updated with the new features, and with an easier interface to use than the visual_slam package (all the RGBD stuff will be included directly in the rtabmap package). June 2013 * Added new demos (mapping 2d/3d, localization) with a robot (ROS bags included!). See [SLAMDemo](https://code.google.com/p/rtabmap/wiki/SLAMDemo). Example: February 2013 * Long paper accepted in _IEEE Transactions on Robotics_ (all papers [below](https://code.google.com/p/rtabmap/#Papers)). See RTAB-Map tested on 12 data sets! January 2013 * Added a [C++ usage example](https://code.google.com/p/rtabmap/wiki/Example). * Integrated RTAB-Map with [TORO](http://www.openslam.org/toro.html) to make a **6D SLAM demo**. See the page [SLAMDemo] if you want to try the demo. In this example, we use a hand-held Kinect sensor: we assemble incrementally the map depending on the 6D visual odometry (SIFT features are used), then when a loop closure is detected using RTAB-Map, TORO is used to optimize the map with the new constraint. December 2012 * Version 0.5.0. * Moved all sensorimotor stuff to the new project [SeMoLearning](http://semolearning.googlecode.com). Now RTAB-Map contains only things about loop closure detection using a Bayesian bag-of-words approach, as in the RTAB-Map related [papers](https://introlab.3it.usherbrooke.ca/mediawiki-introlab/index.php/RTAB-Map#Publications). This also simplified the interface. * I added a new option from the menu to print the detected loop closure IDs in the application console (in MATLAB matrix format, for fast copy/paste in MATLAB). * Also, when generating the map using the menu action, a tip is printed in the application console to know how print a pdf from the ".dot" file with Graphiz: ``` neato -Tpdf Graph.dot -o out.pdf ``` May 2012 * Five new videos (720p) from other community data sets can be found on [RTAB-Map's page at IntRoLab](http://introlab.3it.usherbrooke.ca/mediawiki-introlab/index.php/RTAB-Map). March 2012 * Release 0.3.2: * Simplified RTAB-Map's main parameters by adding a basic panel in Preferences. November 2011 * I've made a simple interface to play with feature detectors and descriptors of OpenCV. See it at [Find-Object](http://find-object.googlecode.com). July 2011 * New videos with different data sets are added to the [home page](http://introlab.3it.usherbrooke.ca/mediawiki-introlab/index.php/RTAB-Map).
